title: Student-Centered Assessment Design to Strengthen Real-World Social Problem-Solving Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational social science theories and research methodologies
context.additional_context: A course focused on cultivating practical problem-solving skills required in social contexts. Online activities using personal BYOD devices and offline collaborative workshops are conducted in parallel.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze community issues and propose actionable solutions
Learners can visualize real-world social issues through digital tool proficiencies (survey analysis, infographic creation, etc.)
Learners can demonstrate collaborative competencies in team-based projects and complete final deliverables according to evaluation criteria

resources: Online Collaboration Tools (e.g., Google Workspace, Miro)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
